programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Daisy wins a place on TV quiz show Pointless and chooses Lucy as her partner - but changes her mind when Lee convinces the women of his intellectual prowess. The only problem is, he wasn't entirely honest with his friends, and now he has to appear on the programme knowing he's really a bit thick. Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman guest star in the sitcom, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee's dad Frank moves in after an argument with his latest fancy woman, but it soon becomes clear he's drinking too much, so the flatmates stage an intervention. programme.title: Coast

programme.title: Coast

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. The moors and valleys of West Yorkshire were the home of, and inspiration for, the Brontes, the literary family who produced such classics as Wuthering Heights and Jane Eyre. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.sub-title: Walking Through History: Norman Conquest of Pembrokeshire
programme.desc: Tony Robinson heads to the south-west corner of Wales and one of Britain's finest coastal paths to find out why Pembrokeshire feels so English, even though it's more than 100 miles from the border. With its numerous castles and a fine cathedral, there are sure signs the Normans stamped their mark over the area. Tony's four-day walk traces the story of their conquest of the county, which he discovers was very different from the knockout victory at Hastings, involving a long, fiercely fought struggle.

programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.desc: The naturalist continues to explore the secrets behind evolution, this time focusing on the animal kingdom's bizarre hybrids, including the 'pizzly bear', a cross between a polar bear and a grizzly, which is thought to have come into being as a result of global warming. He also covers the killer bee brought into existence due to the transfer of African bees to South America.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Footage of animals that have unusual means of finding their way around. Dung beetles are able to navigate by the sky, using the position of the sun, moon and stars to determine which is the right direction to go in, while pigeons display remarkable powers of memory, able to recall complex travel routes and follow manmade roads and hedgerows.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The first of three programmes about the wildlife, landscape and culture in different areas of the country explores the Sierra Madre mountains, and reveals how this rugged landscape has shaped the nation. This chain of peaks includes several volcanoes and is home to a wide variety of animals, including black bears, monarch butterflies, orchid bees and quetzals. The programme also visits the ruins of an ancient Aztec shrine and the blue agave plant which grows in the mountains is used in making tequila.

programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: Exploring the forests of the Yucatan Peninsula, which contain the ruins of the Mayan civilisation and a wide range of wildlife, including jaguars, monkeys and tropical birds. programme.title: Mexico: Earth's Festival of Life
programme.desc: The series concludes by exploring the north of the country, which is dominated by two deserts - the Sonoran and the Chihuahuan. The programme explores the conditions that have shaped this environment, and reveals how animals including prairie dogs, pygmy owls and aplomado falcons have adapted to thrive in these arid conditions.

programme.title: Blue Planet II

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The lads receive an emergency call while on jungle manoeuvres Down Under, and rush off to Hope Bay, the village adjacent to their camp, which has just been devastated by a cyclone. Taylor manfully puts affairs of the heart on hold to supervise rescue operations, but unfortunately, not everyone can be saved.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier

Sam gets emotionally involved in the case of a teenage girl with hepatitis C whose parents seem to know little about her medical history, and Matt struggles to fight his growing attraction to patient Nikki.

programme.title: Casualty

Holly receives a shock in the form of a mystery birthday card from Patrick's secret admirer. Drama with the staff of Holby's accident and emergency department, starring Robert Gwilym, Ronnie McCann and Ben Keaton.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel sets about looking for a job. David is pleased to receive a visit from the police, and the financial noose tightens around Frank's neck.

Prunella Scales guest stars.

programme.desc: Seymour vows that the days of Edie having to carry a dustbin are over, and promises to install a waste disposal unit for her. Meanwhile, a former wartime comrade of Wally's makes an appearance. Michael Aldridge, Thora Hird and Joe Gladwin star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Having witnessed his sister Edie fail several driving tests, Seymour gallantly volunteers to help teach her. However, because he is unable to control a vehicle himself, he needs a qualified motorist to ride along. Michael Aldridge and Thora Hird star.

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Celebrity portrait painter Agatha Troy asks Alleyn to investigate the death of a venerable Shakespearean actor whose portrait she had been commissioned to paint. Drama, starring Patrick Malahide, with Belinda Lang.

Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance by Barnaby Kay.

programme.title: Silent Witness

programme.desc: A drug user's angry mother refuses to be pacified and directs her fury at Max. Meanwhile, the paramedics rush to a remote cottage where a boy has been knocked unconscious. Medical drama, starring Robert Gwilym and Derek Thompson.

Roger Valentine makes fun of Tony Stamp's hearing problem, but a routine check-up at the hospital proves anything but funny.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil receives some devastating news from Kathy. Frank faces up to an unpleasant reality. Shelley gets caught up in a Fowler feud, and Mark discovers he has a fairy godmother.

programme.title: London's Burning

programme.desc: Stubborn postmistress Evie does her best to make Kim feel unwelcome, but a secret from her past soon explains the shopkeeper's icy attitude. Billy is shocked when he gets the job at the factory, David and Megan come to terms with their news, and Nathan lands himself in trouble. Drama, guest starring Elaine Paige.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon tries to make the best of her job at the bakery and Dorien joins the Open University, while Tracey continues to study at the school of hard knocks. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey moves out of Grantleigh Manor, and Richard and his mother move in, disappointing the former resident with their new ways. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour comes up with another madcap scheme to harness the power of nature using an old sail, a pair of roller skates and, in Compo, a very gullible 'test pilot'. Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: When You Take a Good Bite, Yorkshire Tastes Terrible
programme.desc: When Clegg receives news of an old friend dying in America, Compo and Seymour join him on a journey down memory lane, recalling time spent at school walking on gates and climbing trees - forgetting, of course, that it was many years ago. Poignant instalament of the long-running comedy, featuring the final appearance of Joe Gladwin as Wally Batty.

programme.desc: The discovery of a Roman sword with traces of blood on it is linked to an unidentified, headless corpse found near Heathrow in March 2008. It leads the team members to a lock-up belonging to a bodybuilder called Mark Rix, who died of a suspected heart attack the same year, so they start looking for connections between the original murder and Rix's death. They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Tracy-Ann Obermann and Liz White guest star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Sam is not convinced a sports agent committed suicide, after a post-mortem reveals she was in the early stages of pregnancy and bruising to her arms suggests a sexual assault. Matters are complicated further when a client she was planning a new life with is found dead in her flat and tests reveal the father of her baby is Caucasian, putting her husband back in the frame, despite his alibi.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Walter soon feels the heat when he manages to set his flat on fire, Simon clashes with Ruth over her commitment to the job and Peggy finally reaches an understanding with her son Stephen.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Left to look after Felsham Hall until it has been sold, Lovejoy uses the house as a furniture showroom. It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is threatened by a debt collector over a long outstanding sum and his hopes of meeting the repayment rest on a silver tankard, and hijacking a local auction administered by Charlotte Cavendish to obtain an antique piece of Japanese pottery. Meanwhile, newcomer Beth Taylor gives Eric and Tinker a helping hand. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Having finally recovered from the death of his beloved Teresa, Sharpe marries Jane Gibbons. Before the honeymoon is over, he is forced to rush off and capture a fort behind French lines - and while he is away a fever outbreak threatens to cut short his new marriage. Sean Bean stars.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Pru from the Embassy visits Barry in jail and reassures the gang they are doing everything they can to free him - but the Cubans have discovered his Russian connections and convinced themselves he is a spy. Neville feels the pressure as he is forced to home in on his target, and Oz faces a major setback in his relationship with Ofelia. Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Kevin Whately star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A terrified Neville is kidnapped, driven through the back streets of Havana and deposited at an empty house - where he is greeted by Pru from the Embassy, who asks him to trap rogue operative Tarquin. Meanwhile, there is still no sign of Barry being released from jail, and his deteriorating condition prompts Oz to make a heartbreaking decision. Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate mysterious goings-on when a woman dies after being picked from the audience to assist a magician in a stage trick.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan star as chalk-and-cheese detectives determined to find the killer of a once-promising rugby player's wife. Clues point to the husband - but the duo suspect it could be part of a conspiracy. Adapted by Alan Plater from Reginald Hill's award-winning crime novels, with Ralph Brown and Susannah Corbett.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: A couple stumble upon the body of an elderly man in the old hospital wing of an abandoned mental health facility, strapped to a gurney with electrodes connected to his temples.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates the poisoning of a former hangman, while romance is in the air for Mrs McCarthy. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A serial arsonist targets sites related to the 1983 general election. After risking his life in a burning building following a quiet word from Keats, Ray gets personally involved in the high-profile investigation - which forces him to face his traumatic past as it becomes clear the tragic events of the Falklands War are driving the firestarter to murder. Fantasy drama, with Dean Andrews and Joe Absolom (Doc Martin).

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Gene jeopardises a covert operation into a drug cartel when he learns several dealers have been murdered recently and the crimes are linked to an old adversary. Chris falls for the attractive undercover officer, but his feelings prompt a violent outburst that threatens his future in the police, and Alex gathers more clues about why she remains in the 1980s. With guest star Zoe Telford (Criminal Justice).

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reopens the investigation into an actress's disappearance when clips of her being assaulted in a 1990 movie are posted on the internet. Director Don Maddox features in the footage, but when questioned, he appears to have problems distinguishing fact from fiction. A potential witness is then found dead, and Brian and Jack are seconded to the unit handling the case, only to find Emily Driscoll (Dennis Waterman's daughter Hannah) is heading the operation. Imogen Stubbs and Sandra Dickinson also guest star.

Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.desc: Robert tries to arrange a love-match between Eleanor and one of his old comrades-in-arms, but meets with a conspicuous lack of success. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave, David Calder and Nicholas Farrell.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor unwittingly saves the life of a brutal East End villain, who begins terrorising patients and staff alike. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Girl
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama, starring Siobhan Flynn. A dying woman takes her daughter to the home of her former lover, a wealthy mine agent, who takes the child in. But the man's wife is less than happy about the arrangement and determines to keep the girl apart from her own offspring. With Jonathan Cake, Mark Benton and Susan Jameson.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Regina and George return to Ash Park from their wedding, and are warned about their marriage of convenience by Elizabeth and Carolyn. Meanwhile, Sarah attempts to arrange Rene's funeral and is offered emotional and practical support by Roy and Doris Collins. Elsewhere, Gino accidentally finds and reads Ann's novel, and Elizabeth is invited to a function in Sydney by Douglas Goddard.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: George consummates his marriage to Regina after she spikes his drink with morphine, and warns her it will never happen again. Sarah returns to work at the hospital, although Jack worries it is too soon after Rene's death, and Douglas invites Elizabeth to accompany him on holiday.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Relishing the social prestige it confers, Hyacinth decides that she and husband Richard should have a weekend at a golfing hotel so that she can keep up with the Major and his wife. Roy Clarke's suburban sitcom, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth is thrown into dismay when her beloved father goes to the register office to be married, and things go from bad to worse when her neighbour Emmett comes face to face with her uncouth relatives, Daisy, Onslow and Rose.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth dreads the idea of attending Onslow's birthday celebrations. However, she changes her mind when she learns a limousine will be arriving to take her to the party. Starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne oversees the opening of a family planning clinic at the local community centre, leading mother-of-three Wilma Goddens to start taking the contraceptive pill behind her husband's back. Barbara is distraught when she discovers that her father has accepted a missionary posting in New Guinea for the next three years so will not be able to officiate at her wedding, while Violet suffers terribly with hot flushes, Christopher asks Trixie to meet his daughter, and Delia's heartache may finally be over.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: Fairley and Harrow are sent to the Outback to investigate a multiple-death car collision in Fairley's home town of Eurella Creek. When Fairley finds out that Harrow slept with Grace, he bluntly tells him he has a tendency to ruin people's lives. Harrow also learns that Fairley is a local hero for rescuing three children from a house fire in 1991, but still feels guilty about failing to rescue the fourth one. Maxine confronts Grace about not facing the demons of her past. Australian drama, starring Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The team is drawn into the world of a strict religious sect when a father and son are murdered with copies of the Bible at their sides. Burke grows increasingly irate as the secretive community closes ranks, refusing to speak to non-members, and he suspects the leader James Hardie knows more about the killings than he is letting on. Meanwhile, Reid investigates the disappearance of an old friend's daughter and uncovers a link to Burke's case. Detective drama, guest starring Sandy Morton, with Alex Norton and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Pathologist Duncan Clark (Davood Ghadami) begins work with Burke and Reid on the case of a tortured and mutilated body found in a vacant warehouse. After identifying the victim as newly qualified doctor Scott Clarkson, they discover he may been involved in a drugs scam, but the investigation is complicated by the unexpected arrival of London cops DI Casey and DS Moretti. Glasgow-set detective drama, guest starring Reece Dinsdale (Coronation Street) and Steve John Shepherd (Plus One), with Blythe Duff, John Michie and Alex Norton.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Dalziel witnesses a shooting through a neighbour's window and rushes to the scene to find a dead woman, whose husband is suspected of being responsible for the incident. Feature-length drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Michael Kitchen and Josette Simon.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry celebrates his birthday at a comedy club, where a controversial act comes under fire from a group of hecklers. Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw.

Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian revives another classic game show with an episode of The Price Is Right. Eight members of the studio audience will be invited to 'Come on Down' and spin the famous wheel, guess the value of assorted items, and compete in the Epic Showcase for the chance to win a mountain of prizes.

programme.title: Casino Royale (2006)
programme.desc: James Bond achieves his '00' status and is dispatched on the trail of Le Chiffre, an international criminal financing terrorist organisations around the world. Bond's investigation leads to a casino in Montenegro, where he takes part in a high-stakes poker game in a bid to bankrupt Le Chiffre and put an end to his plans. Spy thriller, directed by Martin Campbell and starring Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007, with Eva Green, Mads Mikkelsen, Judi Dench and Giancarlo Giannini.

credits.actor: Daniel Craig in his first outing as 007

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: Keith Lemon and Paddy McGuinness recreate James Cameron's 1991 sci-fi blockbuster Terminator 2: Judgment Day. The comic duo are joined by an all-star cast including Jaime Winstone, Rick Astley and Hank Osasuna to tell the story of a cyborg that is sent back in time to protect the future saviour of the human race from a shape-changing assassin.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to 10,000

programme.title: Super 4

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's hunting down a rat in his attic, Magoo finds himself on the theme park, devoted to... the glory of Fizz..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo comes across Fizz encased in ice and thinks he has found a prehistoric man. He thaws him out and acts like a caveman, so as not to distress him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's helping out at an understaffed veterinary clinic. In fact, he's at the supermarket, where Fizz is trying to sell his cleaning products..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: An unusual stray dog arrives at the Mikkelsens and is welcomed in with open arms. Mike, however, has suspicions. Who is this new pup.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Tom walks in and catches Mercury trying to break into in the garage. He thinks Mercury would make the cool, exciting pet he's always wanted.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: An endless cacophony of loud noises from next door drives Mr Bean to distraction, filling his mind with thoughts of revenge.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean pretends he's been the victim of an accident in the hope of gaining attention, but ends up in hospital.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: A small village's goats are being terrorized.

programme.title: LEGO DC Comics: Batman Be-Leaguered (2014)
programme.desc: All your Lego favourites as Batman refuses to join the Justice League. But when Superman, the Flash, Aquaman and Wonder Woman disappear it's up to Batman to save the day.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave is given a bulb to grow. Popping it in his lunch box, it isn't long before he discovers it's partial to Betty's sandwiches..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George adapts the spin cycle of the washing machine causing a black hole to form in the Spuds' kitchen..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Nick Nairn for a trip aboard luxury train the Royal Scotsman. During the journey, James visits the train's kitchens to prepare a traditional duck a l'orange. Along the way they stop off at a bakery in a former prisoner of war camp and historic Scone Palace, where they prepare ham and cheese toastie in the grounds.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Cookery show with John Torode and Lisa Faulkner, featuring recipes, shortcuts, inspiration and tips.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan shows how to grow a summer feast of strawberries, even if the only space available is a doorstep, and family-friendly ways to grow delicious vegetables. His Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney join in from their homes with clever hacks and tips to get viewers making the most out of their gardens, window boxes or windowsills.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle tries his hand at competitive sheep shearing in north Wales and Liz Bonnin is on the Isle of Mull, spotting pods of migrating dolphins who are returning to the shores. Plus, a visit to the Sussex home of Zoe Ball, who gives a tour of her own back garden before heading off to the National Trust's Standen House for some tips on how to make her garden grow.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian revives another classic game show with an episode of The Price Is Right. Eight members of the studio audience will be invited to 'Come on Down' and spin the famous wheel, guess the value of assorted items, and compete in the Epic Showcase for the chance to win a mountain of prizes.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: John Barnes and Matt Le Tissier were both flying the flag for England in the recent ITV show Harry's Heroes - but now they're on different sides as they take part in the knockout quiz, captaining teams comprising members of their own families in a bid to make it through to the next round. At stake for the eventual winners is 25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The Chase star Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty is the one asking the questions for once.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: Swindon in Wiltshire plays host to David Dickinson and his dealers. Tim Hogarth and Tracy Thackray-Howitt meet a host of creature collectibles, while Stewart Hofgartner looks to lock down a deal on a decorative safe.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, which sees a family from Leeds competing to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of popular culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Jurassic Park III (2001)
programme.desc: Palaeontologist Dr Alan Grant is lured to a dinosaur-infested island by a divorced couple who offer to fund his research, unaware their real motive is to find their missing son - and that the creatures on the island are far more intelligent than anyone suspected. Action adventure sequel, starring Sam Neill, William H Macy, Tea Leoni and Alessandro Nivola.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Ruth Davidson, Mark King, Ferne McCann and Dan Walker pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018)
programme.desc: Three years after the destruction of Jurassic World, Owen Grady and Claire Dearing are asked to return to the theme park to save its resident dinosaurs from the island's active volcano. During their mission, they uncover a conspiracy that may affect the entire planet. Action sequel, starring Chris Pratt, Bryce Dallas Howard, Rafe Spall and Toby Jones.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Happy 60th Birthday
programme.desc: In honour of his 60th birthday, this special programme celebrates the illustrious career of Bradley Walsh, from stand-up comedy and presenting, to quiz shows and acting. As well as forgotten gems from the telly archives, his 1980s fashion choices and hairstyles, viewers will also get to relive those moments of TV gold that have turned him into one of the country's most adored stars. Presented by Jason Manford.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of people who were abandoned as babies, helping them try to find their birth families and know their identities. David McBride was left in a car as a two-week-old infant in January 1962, while Helen Ward was left in a tartan bag in a telephone box in Dundalk in 1968.

programme.title: Don't Ask Me Ask Britain
programme.desc: Live interactive comedy game show hosted by Alexander Armstrong, which uses an app to poll the viewing public on moral dilemmas big and small. Celebrity teams, led by Frank Skinner and Jonathan Ross, go head to head to try and second guess the views of the nation.
